document.docAuthor: Antić, Dragan Ž. & Makarov, Slobodan E.
document.masterDocTitle: The Caucasus as a major hotspot of biodiversity: Evidence from the millipede family Anthroleucosomatidae (Diplopoda, Chordeumatida)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Caucasus as a major hotspot of biodiversity: Evidence from the millipede family Anthroleucosomatidae (Diplopoda, Chordeumatida)

heading.emphasis:
Acanthophorella chegemi
gen. et sp. nov.

Distal view. c = coxite; t = telopodite; al = anterior part of lateral lamella; cp = coxal process; cv = coxal vesicle; mp = medial shield; pl = posterior part of lateral lamella; sp = sternal plate; ss = sternal sac; tp = thorn-like process; us = undefined structure; ppr = posterior projection.

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. The new species differs from the other two species of the genus by the presence of lateral lamellae which are almost the same height as anterior thorn-like processes and by the general shape of the gonopod.
Etymology. The new species is named after its type locality, Chegem District, a noun in apposition.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Type locality.
RUSSIA : Kabardino-Balkaria , Chegem District ,
5 km S of Upper Chegem
,
2100–2200 m
asl, timber-line of
Betula
,
Rhododendron
&
Juniperus .

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. Body with 31 segments (including telson) in adults.
MEASUREMENTS. Males 8–9.5 mm long, vertical diameter of the largest pleurotergite 0.7–0.8 mm . Females 8– 10.5 mm long, vertical diameter of the largest pleurotergite 0.8–0.9 mm .

HEAD . Flattened in males. Labrum with three medial teeth and 5+5 labral and 2+2 supralabral setae. Promentum triangular, without setae. Lingual plates with 4+4 setae. Stipites with ca 20+20 setae. Antennae 1.4 mm long in paratype male. Length of antennomeres (in mm): I (0.07), II (0.16), III (0.38), IV (0.18), V (0.32), VI (0.17), VII (0.1) and VIII (0.02). Length/breadth ratios of antennomeres I–VII: I (1), II (2), III (5.5), IV (2.3), V (3.2), VI (1.5) and VII (1.1). Antennomeres II, IV, V, VI and VII with one, three, one, four and one sensillum, respectively. Number of ocelli 13–16, arranged in 4–5 rows in both sexes.
COLLUM. Narrower than head, with six macrochaetae. Anterior edge semi-circular, posterior margin gently concave.

BODY SEGMENTS ( Figs 121 , 122 ). Lateral keels like lateral swellings. Macrochaetae long and trichoid. CIX (pleurotergite 15) ~ 0.7; MIX (pleurotergite 15) ~ 1.8; PIX (pleurotergite 15) ~ 0.5; MA (pleurotergite 15) ~ 105˚.
TELSON. Epiproct with a pair of spinnerets and 3+3 setae (1+1 paramedian, 2+2 marginal). Hypoproct with 1+1 apical setae. Paraprocts with 3+3 marginal setae.
WALKING LEGS . In both sexes, leg-pairs 1 and 2 with tarsal combs; prefemora with several long and robust setae; femora and postfemora with a group of several long and robust setae.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 121.
Acanthophorella chegemi
gen. et sp. nov. , paratype male habitus. Scale line = 1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: MALE SEXUAL CHARACTERS ( Fig. 123 ). Leg-pairs 3–7 enlarged. Leg-pair 3 and 4 each with a basal exterior protrusion on prefemur. Leg-pair 5 with a basal oral protrusion on prefemur. Leg-pair 6 with a small, basal, exterior protrusion on prefemur. Leg-pair 7 with a posterior, wide, subtriangular, thin, lamellar process on coxae. Leg-pair 10 with coxal glands and with a coxal horn orientated posteriorly. Leg-pair 11 with coxal glands, no other peculiarities.

Acanthophorella chegemi

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution. Russia (known only from type locality) ( Fig. 169 , yellow circle).
